remarks: Show that the support of a function is contained in a set.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2014.)  Obsolete version of ~ suppss as of 28-May-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
suppssOLD.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
suppssOLD.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( A \ W ) ) -> ( F ` k ) = Z ) $.
suppssOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( `' F " ( _V \ { Z } ) ) C_ W ) $.
$d F k $.
$d W k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
